user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n:
```c
bool
MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n (const char *quoted,
                                     size_t quoted_len,
                                     const char *unquoted,
                                     size_t unquoted_len)
{
  size_t i;
  size_t j;
  if (unquoted_len < quoted_len / 2)
    return false;

  j = 0;
  for (i = 0; quoted_len > i && unquoted_len > j; ++i, ++j)
  {
    if ('\\' == quoted[i])
    {
      i++; /* Advance to the next character */
      if (quoted_len == i)
        return false; /* No character after escaping backslash */
    }
    if (! charsequalcaseless (quoted[i], unquoted[j]))
      return false; /* Different characters */
  }
  if ((quoted_len != i) || (unquoted_len != j))
    return false; /* The strings have different length */

  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n:
_MHD_static_inline bool
charsequalcaseless (const char c1, const char c2)
{
  return ( (c1 == c2) ||
           (isasciiupper (c1) ?
            ((c1 - 'A' + 'a') == c2) :
            ((c1 == (c2 - 'A' + 'a')) && isasciiupper (c2))) );
}
...
_MHD_static_inline bool
isasciiupper (char c)
{
  return (c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z');
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found regarding Rule 17.2. The function MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n contains no call to itself. The only function calls it makes are to charsequalcaseless and isasciiupper; the provided definitions for these functions do not call MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n (they are simple, non-recursive helpers). There are no function pointers, callbacks, or macros in the shown code that could expand to an indirect call back to MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n. Therefore there is no direct or indirect recursion to investigate.
